title: Are there any bands who have no original members left but are still playing and or recording? - Quora

response.answer_text: Original Question: Are there any bands who have no original members left but are still playing and or recording? Yes. Here’s the original lineup of English progressive rock band Yes, formed in 1968: Jon Anderson (lead vocals)Peter Banks (guitar, backing vocals)Tony Kaye (keyboards)Chris Squire (bass, backing vocals)Bill Bruford (drums)Here is the lineup for the band currently calling themselves Yes, on last year's “Quintessential Yes: 50th Anniversary Tour:” Jon Davison (lead vocals)Steve Howe (guitar, backing vocals)Geoff Downes (keyboards)Billy Sherwood (bass, backing vocals)Alan White (drums)(To be fair, Howe and White have been associated with various iterations of Yes for decades. And it is no exaggeration to point out that Yes has had numerous musicians in its roster over the past half-century.) The most recent studio album issued under the name Yes is Heaven & Earth from 2014. It featured one original member: Chris Squire. When the album was released, Squire had the distinction of being the only member who appeared on every single Yes studio album. Squire passed away in June of 2015. When Yes began a new tour later that year in August, the first show was the first time Yes had ever performed on stage without Squire.

Bands change personnel all the time, with very few exceptions, but most have at least one original or even ‘classic line-up’ member.Molly Hatchet has zero original members and the bass player, who has been in and out of the band for years holds the rights to the name. He was a post classic line-up member. Many the other founding members (including guitarist Dave Hlubeck, who did found the band) have died.
